isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - AUTOMATIC POSITIVE LOCKING TRACTION DIFFERENTIALS (NOSPIN/DETROIT LOCKER)

svcsection.title: AUTOMATIC POSITIVE LOCKING TRACTION DIFFERENTIALS (NOSPIN/DETROIT LOCKER)

svcproc.title: WARNINGS
svcproc.para: Text and illustrations provided by Dyneer Corporation.

warning.para: Failure to follow these instructions will result in property damage and personal injury.

Any increase in the size of the vehicle's engine, tires, weight, etc., may prohibit use of a NoSPIN/Detroit Locker differential in a previously approved application. Any such modifications should be reviewed by International Engineering before continuing to use the product.
Do not use heat to disassemble drive axles. To do so can destroy heat treat properties and weaken or distort axle components.

Turn the engine off and raise all driving wheels of a NoSPIN/Detroit Locker differential equipped axle when servicing wheels, brakes, axles or tires to prevent the vehicle from moving. Axles equipped with NoSPIN/Detroit Locker differentials deliver power to both wheels-even when only one wheel is on the ground.

NoSPIN/Detroit Locker differentials have compressed springs. Use a retaining bolt or some other restraining means when separating the differential case halves (refer to RETAINING BOLT
).

When repairing NoSPIN/Detroit Locker differentials, if major components show excessive wear, the complete differential should be replaced. If a part is replaced, mating parts should also be replaced in that it is likely that they too are damaged. Use of worn or damaged components can lead to a recurrence of the original problem. NOTE: Use only International approved parts when repairing NoSPIN/Detroit Locker differentials.

Do not operate the vehicle if both wheels of a NoSPIN/Detroit Locker differential equipped axle are not driving. Power to only one wheel can cause serious steering problems. Perform the installation and operation tests under TEST
before putting the vehicle into service.

Use extreme caution when accelerating or decelerating on slippery or unstable surfaces. Vehicles/axles equipped with traction differentials are inherently more sensitive to side-slip than vehicles equipped with conventional differentials.

Distribute the load evenly side-to-side, do not exceed the vehicle's rated payload capacity, and keep the diameter of the tires equal. Failure to observe these measures can create a difference in individual wheel speeds which can cause the NoSPIN/Detroit Locker differential to deliver power to only one side of the vehicle and thus cause steering problems.

Operate in low gear when coasting downhill into a turn. Braking capacity is reduced when a NoSPIN/Detroit Locker differential equipped vehicle makes a turn while coasting downhill in that the inside wheel is then disconnected from the driveline.
